alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Coastal Cumberland; Kennebec; Lincoln; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Kennebec, southeastern Androscoggin, northwestern Lincoln, east central Cumberland and northwestern Sagadahoc Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 729 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Winthrop to near Gray. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lewiston, Brunswick, Augusta, Bath, Gardiner, Topsham, Cumberland, Falmouth, Freeport, Gray, Litchfield, Farmingdale, Manchester, Hallowell, Winthrop, Yarmouth, Lisbon, Harpswell, Greene and Durham. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 between mile markers 14 and 51. Interstate 95 between mile markers 57 and 67, and between mile markers 77 and 112. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Coastal Cumberland; Kennebec; Lincoln; Sagadahoc
